name.fi: Ice Loads on Structures D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Ice Loads on Structures D, Föreläsning
name.en: Ice Loads on Structures D, Lecture

workload.fi: Lectures 24h, excercises 18h, independent work 95h
workload.sv: Lectures 24h, excercises 18h, independent work 95h
workload.en: Lectures 24h, excercises 18h, independent work 95h

prerequisites.fi: Basic knowledge on solid mechanics and ice mechanics.
prerequisites.sv: Basic knowledge on solid mechanics and ice mechanics.
prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge on solid mechanics and ice mechanics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will understand the basic aspects of:
1. Mechanics related to ice induced loads in different loading scenarios: loads due to intact sea ice, loads due to ice ridges and ice rubble, ice breaking process and ice-induced vibration.
2. Analytical and statistical models, and standards related to ice loads on off-shore structures and in ice breaking process.
3. Basics of numerical modeling of ice loads on off-shore structures and in ice-breaking process.
4. Full- and model-scale experimentation on ice induced loads.

Mechanics related to ice induced loads in different loading scenarios: loads due to intact sea ice, loads due to ice ridges and ice rubble, ice breaking process and ice-induced vibration.2. Analytical and statistical models, and standards related to ice loads on off-shore structures and in ice breaking process.3. Basics of numerical modeling of ice loads on off-shore structures and in ice-breaking process.4. Full- and model-scale experimentation on ice induced loads.

Basics of numerical modeling of ice loads on off-shore structures and in ice-breaking process.4. Full- and model-scale experimentation on ice induced loads.

content.fi: This is a course on ice loads on structures and on ice breaking ships. The students are assumed to have prior knowledge on ice mechanics and basic knowledge on solid mechanics.The course concentrates on sea ice loads and provides knowledge necessary for understanding ice loads on off-shore structures.The course is aimed for master's level students in mechanical and civil engineering, but all other students as welcome as well.

prerequisites.fi: Basic knowledge on solid mechanics.
prerequisites.sv: Basic knowledge on solid mechanics.
prerequisites.en: Basic knowledge on solid mechanics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student will remember and understand the basic aspects of:
1               Occurrence, formation and structure of sea ice,
2               Different types of ice,
3               Mechanical properties, failure, and modeling of sea ice as a material,
4               Crushing and contact of ice with structures,
5               Properties, deformation and strength of sea ice sheets / fields,
6               Bearing capacity of ice.

After the course the student will remember and understand the basic aspects of:
1               Occurrence, formation and structure of sea ice,
2               Different types of ice,
3               Mechanical properties, failure, and modeling of sea ice as a material,
4               Crushing and contact of ice with structures,
5               Properties, deformation and strength of sea ice sheets / fields,
6               Bearing capacity of ice.

4               Crushing and contact of ice with structures,
5               Properties, deformation and strength of sea ice sheets / fields,
6               Bearing capacity of ice.

content.fi: An introductory course on ice mechanics. No prior knowledge on ice mechanics, but basic knowledge on solid mechanics is assumed. The course concentrates on sea ice mechanics and provides knowledge necessary for understanding key problems in ice engineering, especially ice loads on ships and marine structures. The course includes lectures and a project work. The course is aimed for master's level students in mechanical and civil engineering, but all other students as welcome as well.

prerequisites.fi: MEC-E5003 Fluid Power Basics or equivalent content
prerequisites.sv: MEC-E5003 Fluid Power Basics or equivalent content
prerequisites.en: MEC-E5003 Fluid Power Basics or equivalent content

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student is able to:
- Describe the principles of modeling and simulation and the potentials of these in system design and analysis
- Use some modeling and simulation environment/software (Matlab ja Simulink)
- Identify (analyze) dynamic structures of hydraulic systems
- Create models for static and dynamic elements (hydraulic and pneumatic components and systems) and run simulations with them
- Identify (analyze) parameter values for models from component catalogs and measurement results
- Analyze dynamic characteristics of hydraulic systems with the help of measurement data (step and frequency responses)
- Analyze the operation of hydraulic systems by modeling and simulation
- Understand the factors which affect the energy consumption of hydraulic systems and how the energy efficiency can be enhanced by changes in system parameters and architectures
- Evaluate critically the quality and deficiencies of a component or system model (i.e. validate the model using measurement data)
- Design and tune an electrohydraulic position, speed and force servo by using modeling and simulation
- Estimate the quality of an electrohydraulic position, speed and force servo by modeling and simulation
- Create well-defined and comprehensive modeling and simulation documents
- Describe the principle of real-time simulation and the special demands of it

prerequisites.fi: KJR-C2004 Materiaalitekniikka or equal bachelor's level Materials science course. Recommended course MEC-E6001 Engineering Metals and Alloys.
prerequisites.sv: KJR-C2004 Materiaalitekniikka or equal bachelor's level Materials science course. Recommended course MEC-E6001 Engineering Metals and Alloys.
prerequisites.en: KJR-C2004 Materiaalitekniikka or equal bachelor's level Materials science course. Recommended course MEC-E6001 Engineering Metals and Alloys.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the students can:
  1. understand plastic deformation, crack growth and their interaction sufficiently to
  2. assess potential life-limiting failure mechanisms in practical engineering cases,
  3. analyze failure cases to gain further insight into life-limiting conditions and opportunities for improvement and finally
  4. use this information to guide safe and efficient use of materials for best performance
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the students can:
  1. understand plastic deformation, crack growth and their interaction sufficiently to
  2. assess potential life-limiting failure mechanisms in practical engineering cases,
  3. analyze failure cases to gain further insight into life-limiting conditions and opportunities for improvement and finally
  4. use this information to guide safe and efficient use of materials for best performance
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the students can:
  1. understand plastic deformation, crack growth and their interaction sufficiently to
  2. assess potential life-limiting failure mechanisms in practical engineering cases,
  3. analyze failure cases to gain further insight into life-limiting conditions and opportunities for improvement and finally
  4. use this information to guide safe and efficient use of materials for best performance

content.fi: The course lectures develop student s existing understanding on deformation, stress concentrations and fracture with emphasis on phenomena underlying various failure mechanisms. Common failure mechanisms (cleavage, fatigue, creep, environmentally assisted degradation) are addressed and published failure cases explained. The students are required to analyze engineering component failure cases and connect the taught content to real life failure cases. The course includes materials testing laboratory exercises, which allow students to get first-hand experience on testing of materials and evaluating materials performance.

prerequisites.fi: KJR-C2004 Materiaalitekniikka or equal bachelor's level Materials science course. Recommended course MEC-E6001 Engineering Metals and Alloys.
prerequisites.sv: KJR-C2004 Materiaalitekniikka or equal bachelor's level Materials science course. Recommended course MEC-E6001 Engineering Metals and Alloys.
prerequisites.en: KJR-C2004 Materiaalitekniikka or equal bachelor's level Materials science course. Recommended course MEC-E6001 Engineering Metals and Alloys.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the students can:
  1. understand plastic deformation, crack growth and their interaction sufficiently to
  2. assess potential life-limiting failure mechanisms in practical engineering cases,
  3. analyze failure cases to gain further insight into life-limiting conditions and opportunities for improvement and finally
  4. use this information to guide safe and efficient use of materials for best performance
learningOutcomes.sv:
After the course the students can:
  1. understand plastic deformation, crack growth and their interaction sufficiently to
  2. assess potential life-limiting failure mechanisms in practical engineering cases,
  3. analyze failure cases to gain further insight into life-limiting conditions and opportunities for improvement and finally
  4. use this information to guide safe and efficient use of materials for best performance
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course the students can:
  1. understand plastic deformation, crack growth and their interaction sufficiently to
  2. assess potential life-limiting failure mechanisms in practical engineering cases,
  3. analyze failure cases to gain further insight into life-limiting conditions and opportunities for improvement and finally
  4. use this information to guide safe and efficient use of materials for best performance

content.fi: The course lectures develop student s existing understanding on deformation, stress concentrations and fracture with emphasis on phenomena underlying various failure mechanisms. Common failure mechanisms (cleavage, fatigue, creep, environmentally assisted degradation) are addressed and published failure cases explained. The students are required to analyze engineering component failure cases and connect the taught content to real life failure cases. The course includes materials testing laboratory exercises, which allow students to get first-hand experience on testing of materials and evaluating materials performance.

prerequisites.fi: MEC-E7001 Production Systems Modelling, MEC-E7002 Manufacturing Methods I, MEC-E7003 Manufacturing Methods II
prerequisites.sv: MEC-E7001 Production Systems Modelling, MEC-E7002 Manufacturing Methods I, MEC-E7003 Manufacturing Methods II
prerequisites.en: MEC-E7001 Production Systems Modelling, MEC-E7002 Manufacturing Methods I, MEC-E7003 Manufacturing Methods II

learningOutcomes.fi: The objective of the course is to combine and crystallize all previous production engineering studies and knowledge. Important part of the course is the practical factory design project. Assignment for the exercise project is to design a real life product manufacturing plant. Different investment calculation models and methods are in focus. Writing supply and delivery agreements and contracts is important. Students are encouraged to use different production planning, modelling and simulation software and systems in layout -planning and production process design. Service and maintenance operations of the factory are also included.

Students are encouraged to use different production planning, modelling and simulation software and systems in layout -planning and production process design. Service and maintenance operations of the factory are also included.

workload.sv: Föreläsningar 18 hÖvningar (individuella övningar) handledda grupper 6 hDemonstrationer 1 hIndividuella studier 18 hTentamen 3 h
workload.en: Lectures 18 hExercises in groups 6 hDemos 1 hIndividual studies 18 hExam 3 h

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija hallitsee perustiedot immateriaalioikeuksista sekä siitä, miten niitä voidaan käyttää liiketoiminnassa. Opiskelija tietää pääpiirteissään alan keskeisen terminologian, hallitsee tiedonhaut sekä osaa laatia patenttihakemuksen. Opiskelija tietää perustiedot alan rahoituksesta, teknologialiiketoiminnasta, toimijoista sekä elinkeinoelämän keskeisistä toimijoista (mm. yritykset, viranomaiset).
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter genomgången kurs behärskar den studerande grunderna i immaterialrätt och hur man kan tillämpa dessa i affärsverksamhet. Känner i huvuddrag till terminologin, behärskar informationssökningen och kan sammanställa en patentansökan. Den studerande känner till grunderna i finansieringen och affärsverksamheten inom området, känner till de centrala aktörerna inom näringslivet (b.la. företag, myndigheter).
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student knows the basics in intellectual property rights and their utilization in business activities. The student knows the essential terminology in the branch, methods for information seeking retrieval and is able to formulate a patent application. The student knows the basics in the financing, technology and start-up venturing and the essential actors together with the entities in the business (e.g. companies and public actors).

content.fi: Kurssilla perehdytään keksintöjen ja liikeideoiden suojaamismahdollisuuksiin kotimaassa ja ulkomailla. Patentti, mallioikeus, tavaramerkki, tekijänoikeus, toiminimi ja suoja sopimatonta menettelyä vastaan. Työsuhdekeksinnöt ja keksinnöt korkeakouluissa. Riitakysymykset.
content.sv: På kursen bekantar man sig med hur man kan skydda affärsidér och uppfinningar inrikes och utomlands. Patent, modellrätt, varumärke, upphovsrätt, firmarätt och skydd mot oanständigt förfarande. Uppfinningar i arbetsavtalsförhållande och uppfinningar vid högskolorna. Tvistefrågor.
content.en: Protecting of inventions and business ideas in Finland and abroad. Patent, design right, trademark and copyright. Inventions during employment at company and at university. Disputes.

assesmentMethods.fi: Patenttihakemuksen laadinta. Tentti.
assesmentMethods.sv: Sammanställa en patentansökan. Tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: Writing a patent application. Exam.

substitutes.sv: Kon-41.5167 Patentit
substitutes.en: Kon-41.5167 Patentit

name.fi: Marine and Ship Systems Engineering D, Luento-opetus
name.sv: Marine and Ship Systems Engineering D, Föreläsning
name.en: Marine and Ship Systems Engineering D, Lecture

workload.fi:
The course utilizes guided problem-based learning concept. System engineering and its application for designing ship and marine traffic systems are introduced at the beginning of the course. Ship and marine systems requirements are also introduced at the beginning of the course and the lectures evolve around them. The course project is to select, describe and justify the choice of ship and marine traffic systems. The lectures introduce the main type of ship and marine traffic systems or equipment and students afterwards consider that topic for their projects. The course includes lectures by experts where ship and marine traffic systems are presented in the context of current case studies. Projects are carried out in groups of 3-5 students, the same as in Principal Naval Architecture.
Load:• Interactive lectures: 20h (2h/week, 10 weeks)• Instructed workshops: 4h (2h/week, 2 weeks)• Group work: 30h (3 hours/week, 10 weeks)• Studying materials: 60h (5 hours/week, 12 weeks)• Preparing for GALA: 20h

prerequisites.fi: Recommended MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture
prerequisites.sv: Recommended MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture
prerequisites.en: Recommended MEC-E1004 Principles of Naval Architecture

learningOutcomes.fi:
Can describe the main requirements of ship systems
Can define and justify an approach to fulfil systems requirements
Can create a concept design of a machinery system by selecting appropriate components, guided by principles of energy efficient design
Can apply current regulatory requirements for ship systems and understands what it takes to go beyond them
Knows the utilization of automation systems in contemporary ship designs
Can describe how adverse environmental effects of ships can be minimized, below the current and known future requirements
learningOutcomes.sv: Can describe the main requirements of ship systemsCan define and justify an approach to fulfil systems requirementsCan create a concept design of a machinery system by selecting appropriate components, guided by principles of energy efficient designCan apply current regulatory requirements for ship systems and understands what it takes to go beyond themKnows the utilization of automation systems in contemporary ship designsCan describe how adverse environmental effects of ships can be minimized, below the current and known future requirements

content.fi: Concepts, principles and tools:System of systems engineering, Ship and marine traffic systems and their integration to ship design, Systems modelling, Design methods and tools (CFD, Augmented Reality e.g. Digital Twins , etc.) Ship systems: Propulsion and plant management, Navigation and maneuvering, Auxiliary power management, Ship Automation, Auxiliary machinery operation, Ballast and trim management. Includes: energy sources and fuel types in modern applications, Modern motor types, exhaust treatment systems, HVAC systems, heat balance and heat recovery systems, energy efficiency, electric systems, fire safety equipment, selected topics on special ship systems (e.g. arctic/sub-arctic conditions). Marine traffic systems: Communication and IT equipment, Internet and ship traffic systems, Satellite communication with marine applications, Environmental impact and legislation.

Includes: energy sources and fuel types in modern applications, Modern motor types, exhaust treatment systems, HVAC systems, heat balance and heat recovery systems, energy efficiency, electric systems, fire safety equipment, selected topics on special ship systems (e.g. arctic/sub-arctic conditions). Marine traffic systems: Communication and IT equipment, Internet and ship traffic systems, Satellite communication with marine applications, Environmental impact and legislation.

Includes: energy sources and fuel types in modern applications, Modern motor types, exhaust treatment systems, HVAC systems, heat balance and heat recovery systems, energy efficiency, electric systems, fire safety equipment, selected topics on special ship systems (e.g. arctic/sub-arctic conditions). Marine traffic systems: Communication and IT equipment, Internet and ship traffic systems, Satellite communication with marine applications, Environmental impact and legislation.

assesmentMethods.fi: The project is assessed weekly with the development of the course assignment(s)(after lecture 3), contributing to 80% of the course grade. Feedback and guidance will be given on the assignments, which will allow for the improved submission in the form of a final report. Learning logs should be provided after every two lectures, contributing to 20% of the course grade.

additionalInformation.fi: Nowadays, the ship design industry is facing stricter maritime regulations, higher competitivity among shipping companies and high fuel price volatility. On the other hand, the alternative fuels and emerging technologies are providing great opportunities for ship designers to succeed in their mission. R&D within industry and research centers in academia are taking the dynamic role building a new network to create innovative objectives and to optimize current situations. The MSSE course aimed at bringing fresh and new ideas of students into the loop. This will be followed by insightful experiencebased rethinking of proposed idea posed by specialists from academia and industries brightening the presented theoretical concepts for students. “MSSE addresses the trade-offs faced when deciding on the alternatives for ship systems and how to select and justify the most optimal solution.” Teaching Language : English Teaching Period : 2022-2023 Autumn II - Spring III 2023-2024 Autumn II - Spring III Enrollment : Registration for the courses will take place on Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi).

R&D within industry and research centers in academia are taking the dynamic role building a new network to create innovative objectives and to optimize current situations. The MSSE course aimed at bringing fresh and new ideas of students into the loop. This will be followed by insightful experiencebased rethinking of proposed idea posed by specialists from academia and industries brightening the presented theoretical concepts for students. “MSSE addresses the trade-offs faced when deciding on the alternatives for ship systems and how to select and justify the most optimal solution.” Teaching Language : English Teaching Period : 2022-2023 Autumn II - Spring III 2023-2024 Autumn II - Spring III Enrollment : Registration for the courses will take place on Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi).

learningOutcomes.fi:
has a understand of entity of indoor environment and impact on health, perceived conditions and productivity
- can estimate the demand of outdoor air
- can calculate the whole body thermal sensation and local thermal comfort
- is aware of pollutants in room air and air cleaning technologies
- is able to analyze noise generation of ventilation system and acoustics in the room spaces
- is able to use evaluation methods, standards and volunteer-based classification methods of indoor climate

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student
- has preliminary readiness to design and size HVAC- systems for residential buildings
- has a basic understanding of building codes for indoor climate and energy efficiency of residential buildings
- has a basic understanding of heating, ventilation, water and sewage systems and their components
- has understanding to set targets for indoor climate and energy efficiency
- has understanding to calculate outdoor air flow rate and  heating power of room space
- has understanding to size ventilation, heating, domestic hot water and sewage systems
- has a basic understanding how building systems are integrated into community infrastructure
learningOutcomes.sv:
After passing the course the student
- has preliminary readiness to design and size HVAC- systems for residential buildings
- has a basic understanding of building codes for indoor climate and energy efficiency of residential buildings
- has a basic understanding of heating, ventilation, water and sewage systems and their components
- has understanding to set targets for indoor climate and energy efficiency
- has understanding to calculate outdoor air flow rate and  heating power of room space
- has understanding to size ventilation, heating, domestic hot water and sewage systems
- has a basic understanding how building systems are integrated into community infrastructure
learningOutcomes.en:
After passing the course the student
- has preliminary readiness to design and size HVAC- systems for residential buildings
- has a basic understanding of building codes for indoor climate and energy efficiency of residential buildings
- has a basic understanding of heating, ventilation, water and sewage systems and their components
- has understanding to set targets for indoor climate and energy efficiency
- has understanding to calculate outdoor air flow rate and  heating power of room space
- has understanding to size ventilation, heating, domestic hot water and sewage systems
- has a basic understanding how building systems are integrated into community infrastructure

content.fi:
- Design assignment of single family house where HVAC system is selected and dimensioned - Assignment covers the main design tasks of HVAC- consulter  - Sizing of HVAC system and main components:
  • targets setting for indoor climate, calculation of outdoor airflow rate and heating power of room spaces,
  • system selection and sizing of ductwork, heating pipes and sewage and domestic hot water systems   
  • sizing of heating plant, air handling unit and control strategy
  • integration of building system into public utilities
  • documentation of HVAC system
- Team work

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student
- has preliminary readiness to design and size HVAC- system in computer aided design (CAD) environment
- enables participants to use simple and advanced computational tools
- has a basic understanding of building information modelling (BIM)
- has understanding of construction and design processes and the tasks of HVAC consulter in different design phases in commercial buildings design
- has a basic understanding of building codes and standards related with HVAC- design of commercial buildings
- enables participants perform basic design documents
- has a basic understanding of the design target setting, system selection, dimension of systems and product selection for non-residential buildings

content.fi:
- Design assignment of commercial building where HVAC system is selected and dimensioned - Assignment is divided into predesign and detailed design phases where the relevant HVAC design tasks are conducted - Preliminary design phase:
  • targets setting for indoor climate, system performance and energy demand.
  • energy and peak load calculations for heating and cooling, system selection and       
  • space demand for HVAC system
- Detailed design phase:
  • Sizing of air handling units, pipe and duct works and room systems.
  • Control strategy
  • Product selection
  • Documents for contract offering and documents for building permit
- Team work

content.fi: Students do an assignment instructed by an Aalto Univesty advisor. The assignment can vary from modelling and simulation to experimental work or litterature review. prerequisites.fi: Basic principles of heat transfer and mixture thermodynamics. E.g. EEN-E1030 Heat Transfer and EEN-E1040 Thermodynamics in Energy Technology or similar courses.
prerequisites.sv: Basic principles of heat transfer and mixture thermodynamics. E.g. EEN-E1030 Heat Transfer and EEN-E1040 Thermodynamics in Energy Technology or similar courses.
prerequisites.en: Basic principles of heat transfer and mixture thermodynamics. E.g. EEN-E1030 Heat Transfer and EEN-E1040 Thermodynamics in Energy Technology or similar courses.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course the student has knowledge of the fundamental theory of the mass transfer and understands its essential physical and chemical phenomena and concepts. The student can apply the theory for analysis, and modelling of various mass transfer processes and phenomena in technology and nature.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course the student has knowledge of the fundamental theory of the mass transfer and understands its essential physical and chemical phenomena and concepts. The student can apply the theory for analysis, and modelling of various mass transfer processes and phenomena in technology and nature.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course the student has knowledge of the fundamental theory of the mass transfer and understands its essential physical and chemical phenomena and concepts. The student can apply the theory for analysis, and modelling of various mass transfer processes and phenomena in technology and nature.

content.fi: Fundamentals of diffusion in gas phase, liquid phase and in porous materials. Stefan flow and Knudsen's diffusion in micropores. Differential equations of mass transfer. Analogy between heat and mass transfer. Forced and natural convection mass transfer. Membrane transport. Applications to heat recovery, cooling systems, drying and separation with membranes.
content.sv: Fundamentals of diffusion in gas phase, liquid phase and in porous materials. Stefan flow and Knudsen's diffusion in micropores. Differential equations of mass transfer. Analogy between heat and mass transfer. Forced and natural convection mass transfer. Membrane transport. Applications to heat recovery, cooling systems, drying and separation with membranes.
content.en: Fundamentals of diffusion in gas phase, liquid phase and in porous materials. Stefan flow and Knudsen's diffusion in micropores. Differential equations of mass transfer. Analogy between heat and mass transfer. Forced and natural convection mass transfer. Membrane transport. Applications to heat recovery, cooling systems, drying and separation with membranes.

assesmentMethods.fi: Written examination, exercise problems and 3-4 assignments.
assesmentMethods.sv: Written examination, exercise problems and 3-4 assignments.
assesmentMethods.en: Written examination, exercise problems and 3-4 assignments.

prerequisites.fi: Compulsory prerequisites: MEC-E1020 Fluid dynamicsRecommended prerequisites: MEC-E1020 Fluid dynamics
prerequisites.sv: Compulsory prerequisites: MEC-E1020 Fluid dynamicsRecommended prerequisites: MEC-E1020 Fluid dynamics
prerequisites.en: Compulsory prerequisites: MEC-E1020 Fluid dynamicsRecommended prerequisites: MEC-E1020 Fluid dynamics

learningOutcomes.fi: CFD software: The student gains the basic skills to setup a simulation case including identification of the relevant incompressible flow equations, boundary conditions, grid generation, initial conditions and numerical solver settings. CFD software and 2d flows: The student gains the basic skills to simulate low Reynolds number flows, boundary layers, von Karman vortices, and flow separation. Quantitative analysis: The student learns to compare simulation results with reference data.  Matlab: The student learns the basics to solve linear equations in 1d. The learns to program a 2d solver for linear convection-diffusion equation.  Discretization and error: The student learns the sources of error and understands the influence of discretization error on numerical solution.
learningOutcomes.sv: CFD software: The student gains the basic skills to setup a simulation case including identification of the relevant incompressible flow equations, boundary conditions, grid generation, initial conditions and numerical solver settings. CFD software and 2d flows: The student gains the basic skills to simulate low Reynolds number flows, boundary layers, von Karman vortices, and flow separation. Quantitative analysis: The student learns to compare simulation results with reference data.  Matlab: The student learns the basics to solve linear equations in 1d. The learns to program a 2d solver for linear convection-diffusion equation.  Discretization and error: The student learns the sources of error and understands the influence of discretization error on numerical solution.
learningOutcomes.en: CFD software: The student gains the basic skills to setup a simulation case including identification of the relevant incompressible flow equations, boundary conditions, grid generation, initial conditions and numerical solver settings. CFD software and 2d flows: The student gains the basic skills to simulate low Reynolds number flows, boundary layers, von Karman vortices, and flow separation. Quantitative analysis: The student learns to compare simulation results with reference data.  Matlab: The student learns the basics to solve linear equations in 1d. The learns to program a 2d solver for linear convection-diffusion equation.  Discretization and error: The student learns the sources of error and understands the influence of discretization error on numerical solution.

content.fi: The course offers a first systematic walk through to computational fluid dynamics (CFD) in the leading open source CFD software environment OpenFOAM. While practical simulation experience is gained in OpenFOAM, theory will be put to practice as well in the Matlab environment. The student learns basics of discretization, grid generation, simulation case set up, and linear solvers. During the course the student learns to work with the Navier-Stokes equations and to compare simulation data with reference solutions in laminar flow regime. Also, a variety of dynamic flow phenomena involving vortex interactions will be covered including flow over a cylinder,  and free shear flows.

During the course the student learns to work with the Navier-Stokes equations and to compare simulation data with reference solutions in laminar flow regime. Also, a variety of dynamic flow phenomena involving vortex interactions will be covered including flow over a cylinder,  and free shear flows.

During the course the student learns to work with the Navier-Stokes equations and to compare simulation data with reference solutions in laminar flow regime. Also, a variety of dynamic flow phenomena involving vortex interactions will be covered including flow over a cylinder,  and free shear flows.

After passing the course the student
  • understands the concepts of ventilation and air-conditioning
  • knows the most common ventilation and air-conditioning systems and their features
  • can calculate the thermodynamic properties of moist air
  • can calculate air flow rates on the basis of given criteria
  • knows the ventilation ductwork sizing methods (e.g. static regain)
  • can choose the supply air flow rate and temperature for a displacement ventilation system
  • can calculate the unit processes and size the components of an air-conditioning system
  • can analyze the operation of an air-conditioning system in practical problems
  • can employ classical control algorithms in the control of air-handling processes

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student
  • knows the key energy consumers in the building s energy balance
  • knows the basic terminology and definitions related to (nearly) net-zero energy buildings, plus energy buildings and hybrid smart grids
  • understands the principles of on-site energy generation, grid interaction and energy matching
  • knows the key sustainable building envelope components, advanced energy storage and HVAC systems
  • knows the key technologies and systems for the utilization of renewable energy
  • understands the relationship between the temperature of the heat source, exergy and the Carnot efficiency in the context of building energy systems (the concept of energy quality)

  • knows the key sustainable building envelope components, advanced energy storage and HVAC systems
  • knows the key technologies and systems for the utilization of renewable energy
  • understands the relationship between the temperature of the heat source, exergy and the Carnot efficiency in the context of building energy systems (the concept of energy quality)

  • Sustainable HVAC technologies (free cooling, high-temperature cooling, low-temperature heating, etc.)
  • Advanced energy storage systems
  • Technologies for renewable energy (solar PVT, wind, biomass, GSHP, mCHP etc.)
  • Energy quality

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student
-has a fundamental understanding of dynamic energy simulation principles
-has a basic understanding of suitable optimisation methodologies
-has preliminary readiness to do energy investment calculations in the building/HVAC sector
-understands the potential of combined simulation and optimisation in planning
-is able to take more advanced tools for combined simulation and optimisation into use
-is able to independently search for more information on the topic and to exploit this information
learningOutcomes.sv:
After passing the course the student
-has a fundamental understanding of dynamic energy simulation principles
-has a basic understanding of suitable optimisation methodologies
-has preliminary readiness to do energy investment calculations in the building/HVAC sector
-understands the potential of combined simulation and optimisation in planning
-is able to take more advanced tools for combined simulation and optimisation into use
-is able to independently search for more information on the topic and to exploit this information
learningOutcomes.en:
After passing the course the student

-has a basic understanding of suitable optimisation methodologies

-is able to take more advanced tools for combined simulation and optimisation into use
-is able to independently search for more information on the topic and to exploit this information

content.fi: Basic principles and methodologies for dynamic building energy simulation using the control volume principle and difference method for mathematical solution, basic principles and methodologies of investment calculations and especially building energy investments, some principles of optimisation methodologies, mainly focused on search algorithms and GA, combining simulation and optimisation, homework, teamwork.
content.sv: Basic principles and methodologies for dynamic building energy simulation using the control volume principle and difference method for mathematical solution, basic principles and methodologies of investment calculations and especially building energy investments, some principles of optimisation methodologies, mainly focused on search algorithms and GA, combining simulation and optimisation, homework, teamwork.
content.en: Basic principles and methodologies for dynamic building energy simulation using the control volume principle and difference method for mathematical solution, basic principles and methodologies of investment calculations and especially building energy investments, some principles of optimisation methodologies, mainly focused on search algorithms and GA, combining simulation and optimisation, homework, teamwork.

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija tunnistaa projekteihin ja projektinhallintaan liittyvät peruskäsitteet ja työkalut. Hän osaa soveltaa tavoitteellisen ryhmätyöskentelyn menetelmiä monialaisissa ryhmissä ja ryhmätyön eri vaiheissa (ryhmän organisoituminen, tavoitteenasettelu, työsuunnitelman laadinta, aikataulutus, tehtävien jako, kommunikointi, toteutuksen seuranta ja dokumentointi). Opiskelija tunnistaa insinöörimäisen lähestymistavan ongelman ratkaisuun. Opiskelija osaa myös soveltaa projektin raportointi- ja esittelymenetelmiä.
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter kursen känner studeranden grundbegreppen och arbetsmetoderna för projektarbete och projektadministration. Hen  kan tillämpa metoder för målorienterat grupparbete i mångdisciplinära grupper och i olika skeden av grupparbetet (organisering av gruppen, målsättning, utarbetning av arbetsplanen, utarbetning av tidsplanen, arbetsfördelning, kommunikation, uppföljning av genomförandet och dokumentering). Studeranden identifierar typiska tillvägagångssätt för problemlösning i ingenjörsarbete. Studeranden kan även tillämpa rapporterings- och presentationsmetoder för projekt.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course, the student recognizes the basic concepts and tools related to projects and project management. Student is able to apply methods of target-oriented group work in a multidisciplinary team in different phases of the group work (organization of the team, goal setting, work planning, scheduling, division of work, communication, follow-up of the implementation and documentation). Student recognizes the engineering approach to problem solving. Student is also able to apply the methods for reporting and presentation of the project.

content.fi: Opintojen alkuvaiheeseen sijoittuva ryhmä- ja projektityötaitoja edistävä sekä yhteisöllisyyttä ja insinööri-identiteetin rakentamista tukeva kurssi. Opiskelijat toteuttavat ja raportoivat pienryhmissä projektin ENG-koulun edustamalta aihealueelta. Projektien teemat ja aihealueet vaihtelevat vuosittain. Kurssin päätteeksi ryhmät havainnollistavat ja esittelevät projektiensa tulokset.
content.sv: Kursen placerar sig i början av studierna och främjar kunskaper i grupp- och projektarbete samt stöder uppbyggnad av studentgemenskap och ingenjörsidentitet. Studerandena verkställer och rapporterar i mindre grupper ett projekt inom ENG-skolans temaområde. Projektens detaljerade teman och målområden varierar från år till år. Vid slutet av kursen åskådliggör och presenterar studerandena resultaten för sitt projekt.
content.en: The course advances group and project work skills and supports the building-up of the communality and engineering identity at the beginning of the studies. Students carry out and report in small teams a project related to the subject area of the School of Engineering. The themes and topics of the projects will vary early. At the end of the course students will demonstrate and present the outcome of their project.

assesmentMethods.fi: Keskeisessä osassa opetusta on itsenäisesti ryhmässä tehtävä projektityö. Projektin etenemistä tuetaan keskeisesti projektityöskentelyyn ja projektin teemaan liittyvillä luennoilla sekä säännöllisillä ohjaustapaamisilla. Kurssin arvostelu pohjautuu projektin aikana suoritettaviin viikoittaisiin osatehtäviin sekä projektin tulosten esittelyyn. Ryhmän toiminnan arvioinnissa hyödynnetään itse- ja vertaisarviointimenetelmiä.
assesmentMethods.sv: En central del av undervisningen är projektarbetet som görs i självständiga grupper. Projekten stöds av föreläsningar och regelbundna handledarmöten med focus på projektens arbetsmetoder och det specifika projekttemat. I kursens bedömning beaktas deluppgifterna/veckouppgifterna och presentationen av projektresultaten. I bedömning av gruppens funktionalitet används själv- och inbördes bedömningsmetoder.
assesmentMethods.en: Central part of the teaching is an independent project work done in a small group. The progress of the project is supported by lectures and instruction meetings related to project working and the theme of the project. The assessment is based on the weekly tasks during the project and the presentation of the project outcome. In the assessment of the team work, self and peer assessment will be utilized.

prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Rekommenderas: KEY-C1010 Johdatus kestäviin yhdyskuntiin ja KEY-C1040 Maankäytön suunnittelun perusteet

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija: -Osaa soveltaa teoreettista tietoa, kestävän kehityksen ja luonnonvarojen kestävän käytön periaatteita sekä yhdyskuntien suunnittelun peruskonsepteja suunnittelutehtävässä
-Osaa havainnollistaa analyysejään ja suunnitelmiaan
-Ymmärtää laajan ja monialaisen suunnittelutehtävän koordinoinnin haasteita ja osaa toimia ryhmän jäsenenä
- Osaa etsiä, tuottaa ja arvioida tietoa ja soveltaa sitä suunnittelutehtävässä
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen en student:
-kan tillämpa teoretisk kunskap, samhällsplaneringens grundläggande principerna, hållbar utveckling, och hållbart nyttjande av naturresurser i planeringsuppgiften-kan illustrera sina analyser och planer-förstår utmaningarna med att koordinera en bred och multidisciplinär planeringsuppgift och kan agera som en gruppmedlem -kan söka, producera och utvärdera information och tillämpa den i en planeringsuppgift
learningOutcomes.en: After the course a student:-can apply theoretical knowledge, the principles of sustainable development and the sustainable use of natural resources, as well as the basic concepts of urban planning in a planning task -can illustrate and communicate one's analyses and plans -understands the challenges of coordinating a broad and multidisciplinary planning task and is able to act as a team member -is able to search, produce and assess information and apply it in a planning task

content.fi: Projektityö, joka sisältää suunnittelutehtäviä, joissa hankitaan taitoja hyödyntää erilaisia suunnittelun osa-alueita, työkaluja ja näkökulmia.
content.sv: Projektarbetet innefattar planeringsuppgifter som ger den studerande färdigheter att integrera olika områden inom planering, verktyg och perspektiv.
content.en: The course is based on a group work project. By using problem-based approach students acquire skills to integrate different sectors and viewpoints as well as tools of planning.

assesmentMethods.fi: Luento-opetus, ohjattu ryhmäharjoitustyö, itsenäinen työskentely
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningar, handlett grupparbete, sjävständigt arbete
assesmentMethods.en: Lectures, tutored group work, independent work.

- tietää liikenteen vaikutusten määrittämismenetelmiä
- ymmärtää liikenteen ja maankäytön vuorovaikutusta rakennetussa ympäristössä
- käsittää liikennejärjestelmän toiminnot ja vaikutukset niitä tuottavien, käyttävien ja kokevien osapuolten kannalta
learningOutcomes.sv: Efter avlagd kurs kan den studerande - förstå trafiksystemets funktionsprinciper - förstå information relaterad till trafiksystemets funktion - identifiera kommande trafik- och transportbehov och fastslå deras genomförbarhet - förstå dimensioner och begrepp inom hållbar utveckling  samt växelverkan inom trafiksystemet - känna till metoder för att bestämma trafikens verkningar - förstå växelverkan mellan trafik och markanvändning i den bebyggda miljön - uppfatta trafiksystemets funktioner och verkningar utgående från de parter som producerar, använder och upplever dessa
learningOutcomes.en: After completing the course the student - understands the operating principles of the transport system - understands information concerning the operation of the transportation system - identifies future mobility and transport needs and is able to define their feasibility - understands the dimensions and concepts of sustainability, and an their interactive relationships in the transportation system - knows the methodology used to determine the impacts of traffic - understands the interaction between transport and land use in built environment - understands the functions of transportation system and their impacts from the point of view of parties which produce, utilize, and experience them

content.fi: Liikennejärjestelmän toimintaperiaatteet. Ekologinen, taloudellinen ja sosiaalinen kestävyys. Kestävän liikennejärjestelmän ominaisuudet. Liikenteen energiankulutus. Eri liikennemuotojen sekä väylien rakentamisen ja ylläpidon vaikutukset maankäyttöön ja ympäristöön. Liikenneturvallisuus. Liikennejärjestelmän kestävyyden arviointi ja kestävyyttä edistävät keinot.
content.sv: Verksamhetsprinciper av ett transportsystem. Ekologisk, ekonomisk och social hållbarhet. Egenskaper av ett hållbart transportsystem. Energianvändningen i transportsektorn. Effekter av olika transportsätt, samt byggande och underhåll till markanvändning och miljö. Trafiksäkerhet. Bedömning av hållbarheten i transportsystemet och medlen att bidra till hållbarhet.
content.en: Operational principles of a transportation system. Ecological, economic and social sustainability. Characteristics of a sustainable transportation system. Energy consumption in transport. Impacts of different transport modes, as well as construction and maintenance of roads to land use and environment. Road safety. Assessment of sustainability of transportation system and means to improve sustainability.

assesmentMethods.fi: Luentokuulustelu tai oppimispäiväkirja, harjoitukset, ryhmätyö ja dialogipäiväkirja. Osasuoritusten painotus kurssiarvostelussa ilmoitetaan kurssin alkaessa, kaikki osat suoritettava hyväksytysti.
assesmentMethods.sv: Föreläsningstentamen eller lärodagbok, uppgifter, grupparbete och dialogdagbok. Viktning av kursdelar i bedömning kommer att tillkännages i början av kursen, alla delar skall vara godkända.
assesmentMethods.en: Lecture exam or learning diary, assignments, group work and dialog diary. Weighting of course parts in grading will be announced at the beginning of the course, all parts shall be passed.

substitutes.en: YYT-C2004 Sustainable transportation system

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Suositeltava esitieto: CS-A1111 Ohjelmoinnin peruskurssi Y1, tai vastaavat tiedot.
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Rekommenderad förkunskap: CS-A1111 Grundkurs i programmering Y1, eller motsvarande kunskaper.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Recommended prerequisite: CS-A1111 Basic Course in Programming Y1, or equivalent skills.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin jälkeen opiskelija:
  • tuntee hydrologisen kiertokulun ja siihen liittyvän veden virtauksen avouomissa ja maaperässä
  • pystyy määrittelemään hydrologian erityispiirteet Suomen olosuhteissa
  • pystyy laskemaan ja arvioimaan hydrologisen kierron suuruusluokkia (sadanta, haihdunta, jne.) ja tuntee niiden mittaamiseen ja arviointiin liittyvät epätarkkuudet
  • löytää avoimet, maailmanlaajuiset hydrologisia tarkasteluja tukevat aineistot ja osaa hyödyntää niitä
  • suhtautuu perustellun kriittisesti hydrologian mittauksiin ja laskentamenetelmien tuottamiin tuloksiin
  • ymmärtää valunnan muodostumisen luonnontilaisilla ja kuivatetuilla alueilla
  • ymmärtää valunnan ja hajakuormituksen välisen yhteyden
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter slutförd kurs den studerande
  • förstår det hydrologiska kretsloppet och därtill hörande vattenflöden (bl. a. grundvattenflöde, kanalströmning)
  • kan beskriva hydrologins karakteristiska egenskaper i Finlands förhållanden
  • kan beräkna storleken på olika flöden i det hydrologiska kretsloppet (avdunstning, nederbörd, osv.), samt känner till osäkerheterna anknutna till mät- och beräkningsmetoderna
  • kan finna och utnyttja öppen global data som stöder hydrologiska analyser
  • kan förhålla sig berättigat kritisk till hydrologiska mät- och beräkningsresultat
  • förstår hur avrinning bildas i olika markanvändningsområden
  • förstår kopplingen mellan avrinning och diffus belastning
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course the student
  • understands how water circulates in the nature
  • can describe the peculiarities of hydrology in Finland
  • can compute and estimate the magnitude of different hydrological fluxes (precipitation, evapotranspiration, etc.) and knows the uncertainties related to their measurement and estimation
  • is aware of the open, global coverage data sets supporting hydrological analyses and can take use of them
  • exercises sound criticism towards the results produced by hydrologic measurements and computation methods
  • understands generation of runoff both in natural and drained areas
  • understands the linkage between runoff and diffuse pollution

content.fi: Hydrologinen kierto ja sen komponentit: sadanta, sulanta, haihdunta, valunta. Veden liikkeet maaperässä ja avouomissa. Hydrologisten suureiden mittaaminen ja laskennallinen arviointi. Maailmanlaajuisten paikkatietoaineistojen hyödyntäminen ja visualisointi hydrologisissa tarkasteluissa. Hajakuormituksen merkitys vesistökuormituksessa.
content.sv: Det hydrologiska kretsloppet och dess komponenter: nederbörd, snösmältning, avdunstning, avrinning. Vattnets rörelser i vattendrag (kanalströmning) och i marken. Hydrologiska mätningar och beräkningsmetoder. Visualisering och användning av global geografisk data vid hydrologiska analyser. Den diffusa belastningens roll inom belastningen av vattendrag.
content.en: Hydrological cycle and its components: rainfall, snowmelt, evaporation, runoff. Movement of water in soil and open channels. Hydrological measurements and computational models. Visualizing and utilizing global coverage spatial datasets in hydrological analyses. The role of diffuse pollution in environmental loading.

assesmentMethods.fi: Kurssi arvostellaan harjoitusten ja tentin perusteella.
assesmentMethods.sv: Kursen bedöms på basis av övningarna och tentamen.
assesmentMethods.en: The course is graded based on the exercises and the exam.

substitutes.en: YYT-C2005 Applied Hydrology

learningOutcomes.fi: The student is familiar with the characteristics of real estate investments, both direct and indirect, and understands the role of real estate in a mixed asset portfolio. The student understands how the characteristics of real estate investment and data issues affect application of standard theories in finance to real estate, and is able to conduct basic analyses.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: Bachelor of Science, with basic knowledge of chemistry, thermodynamics and fluid mechanics.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: Bachelor of Science, with basic knowledge of chemistry, thermodynamics and fluid mechanics.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Bachelor of Science, with basic knowledge of chemistry, thermodynamics and fluid mechanics.

learningOutcomes.fi:
• Know and identify different energy carriers including their physical and chemical properties as well as benefits and limitations for transport and energy storage use
  • Select relevant energy carriers for different transport and energy storage application
  • Understand pathways in energy carrier production
learningOutcomes.sv:
• Know and identify different energy carriers including their physical and chemical properties as well as benefits and limitations for transport and energy storage use
  • Select relevant energy carriers for different transport and energy storage application
  • Understand pathways in energy carrier production
learningOutcomes.en:
• Know and identify different energy carriers including their physical and chemical properties as well as benefits and limitations for transport and energy storage use
  • Select relevant energy carriers for different transport and energy storage application
  • Understand pathways in energy carrier production

content.fi: There is a need for chemical energy carriers such as electro-fuels, biofuels and other renewable raw material based gaseous and liquid solutions. This course presents an overview of different new chemical energy carriers for transport applications with current regulations at European market and for energy storage. Course will present energy carrier scenarios from academia and industry. After the course, the students have wide understanding of the benefits and limitation of the different current and potential future energy carriers.

Course will present energy carrier scenarios from academia and industry. After the course, the students have wide understanding of the benefits and limitation of the different current and potential future energy carriers.
content.en: There is a need for chemical energy carriers such as electro-fuels, biofuels and other renewable raw material based gaseous and liquid solutions. This course presents an overview of different new chemical energy carriers for transport applications with current regulations at European market and for energy storage. Course will present energy carrier scenarios from academia and industry. After the course, the students have wide understanding of the benefits and limitation of the different current and potential future energy carriers.

prerequisites.fi: Recommended prerequisites: No specific requirements. Basic knowledge of thermodynamics, heat transfer and fluid dynamics recommended.
prerequisites.sv: Recommended prerequisites: No specific requirements. Basic knowledge of thermodynamics, heat transfer and fluid dynamics recommended.
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: No specific requirements. Basic knowledge of thermodynamics, heat transfer and fluid dynamics recommended.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After passing the course the student
  • knows the heating and cooling systems of a building and understands their operational principles
  • knows the heat conversion and distribution methods and the fundamentals of automatic control
  • can calculate a building s heat demand
  • can calculate heat gains and cooling load caused by solar radiation
  • understands the impact of thermal mass on the dynamic behavior of buildings

  • knows the heating and cooling systems of a building and understands their operational principles

  • can calculate heat gains and cooling load caused by solar radiation
  • understands the impact of thermal mass on the dynamic behavior of buildings

learningOutcomes.fi: The knowhow needed for a rock facility planner in general or for structural planning. Students are able to: - describe the planning tasks in a rock engineering project - select appropriate rock investigation and rock mechanical modelling methods - select rock excavation and rock reinforcement methods - explain the legal, safety and environmental requirements in rock construction work in small planning group
learningOutcomes.sv: The knowhow needed for a rock facility planner in general or for structural planning. Students are able to: - describe the planning tasks in a rock engineering project - select appropriate rock investigation and rock mechanical modelling methods - select rock excavation and rock reinforcement methods - explain the legal, safety and environmental requirements in rock construction work in small planning group
learningOutcomes.en: The knowhow needed for a rock facility planner in general or for structural planning. Students are able to: - describe the planning tasks in a rock engineering project - select appropriate rock investigation and rock mechanical modelling methods - select rock excavation and rock reinforcement methods - explain the legal, safety and environmental requirements in rock construction work in small planning group

literature.en: Lecture slides, professional handbooks, regulations and standards Recommended literature (examples): Finnish Tunnelling Association 1997: The Fourth Wave of Rock Construction Finnish Tunnelling Association 2011: Rock - sound of countless opportunities Kuesel, King, Bickel 1996: Tunnel Engineering Handbook Carmody & Sterling 1993: Underground Space Design Palmström & Stille 2015: Rock Engineering
literature.fi: Lecture slides, professional handbooks, regulations and standards Recommended literature (examples): Finnish Tunnelling Association 1997: The Fourth Wave of Rock Construction Finnish Tunnelling Association 2011: Rock - sound of countless opportunities Kuesel, King, Bickel 1996: Tunnel Engineering Handbook Carmody & Sterling 1993: Underground Space Design Palmström & Stille 2015: Rock Engineering
literature.sv: Lecture slides, professional handbooks, regulations and standards Recommended literature (examples): Finnish Tunnelling Association 1997: The Fourth Wave of Rock Construction Finnish Tunnelling Association 2011: Rock - sound of countless opportunities Kuesel, King, Bickel 1996: Tunnel Engineering Handbook Carmody & Sterling 1993: Underground Space Design Palmström & Stille 2015: Rock Engineering

content.fi: General planning and special requirements for the typical rock facilities. Special solutions for excavation and reinforcement in rock construction. General elements for underground rock reinforcement design, types of rock reinforcement that may be utilized in the underground environment. Monitoring of rock structures.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student is familiar with the characteristics of real estate markets and assets. The student understands the basic functions of real estate markets, the role of various actors operating in these markets, and the principles of real estate market dynamics. Further, the student understands value concepts, real estate price and profit formation, and the basic principles of valuation. He/she also is able to perform valuation calculations.
learningOutcomes.sv: After the course, the student is familiar with the characteristics of real estate markets and assets. The student understands the basic functions of real estate markets, the role of various actors operating in these markets, and the principles of real estate market dynamics. Further, the student understands value concepts, real estate price and profit formation, and the basic principles of valuation. He/she also is able to perform valuation calculations.
learningOutcomes.en: After the course, the student is familiar with the characteristics of real estate markets and assets. The student understands the basic functions of real estate markets, the role of various actors operating in these markets, and the principles of real estate market dynamics. additionalInformation.fi:
Teaching Language: English Teaching Period: 2024-2025 Autumn I  2025-2026 Autumn I Registration: Registration for the course will take place on Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi). The course is offered only to students in the Master's Programme in Real Estate Economics, Master's Programme Creative Sustainability (Real Estate and Water Management), Master's Programme in Urban Studies and Planning (real estate specialization) and those exchange students who have been pre-admitted to the course.
In addition there is a quota of 7 students from the Master's Programme in Finance at Aalto and 10 other students. These students are selected based on their application to the Minor in Real Estate Economics.The minor students will be selected based on 1) motivation letter and 2) credits attained and academic performance of previous studies.  The motivation letter as well as transcript of records must be submitted to the Mycourses page of the course two weeks before the course starts.

Registration for the course will take place on Sisu (sisu.aalto.fi). The course is offered only to students in the Master's Programme in Real Estate Economics, Master's Programme Creative Sustainability (Real Estate and Water Management), Master's Programme in Urban Studies and Planning (real estate specialization) and those exchange students who have been pre-admitted to the course.

In addition there is a quota of 7 students from the Master's Programme in Finance at Aalto and 10 other students. These students are selected based on their application to the Minor in Real Estate Economics.
The minor students will be selected based on
1) motivation letter and
2) credits attained and academic performance of previous studies.  The motivation letter as well as transcript of records must be submitted to the Mycourses page of the course two weeks before the course starts.

learningOutcomes.fi: After the course, the student is familiar with the characteristics of real estate markets and assets. The student understands the basic functions of real estate markets, the role of various actors operating in these markets, and the principles of real estate market dynamics. Further, the student understands value concepts, real estate price and profit formation, and the basic principles of valuation. He/she also is able to perform valuation calculations.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student:
  • Recognizes the special matters of the one or several sectors of economic or business law. Comprehends the prerequisites of specific sector economic or business law and the possibilities of property and other kind of development and business provided by it.
  • Comprehends the multiphase administrative procedure in economic law sector, as well as the particular challenges to development posed by it from a business point of view.

learningOutcomes.fi:
After the course the student comprehends:
  • the basic content of the cadastre and is able to describe the relations between real estate register, title and mortgage register and legal cadastral surveys
  • land tenure and land administration systems
  • constitutional basis, administrative systems and principles of administrative law
  • land use planning system, public construction law and land use policy
  • legal basis of contract law and real estate purchase legislation
  • outlines of companies legislation

name.en: Introduction to Land Use Planning, Lecture

workload.fi: Luennot, harjoitustyöt
workload.sv: Föreläsningar, övningar
workload.en: Lectures, exercises

prerequisites.fi: Suositellut esitiedot: Suositellaan: KEY-C1010 Johdatus kestäviin yhdyskuntiin
prerequisites.sv: Rekommenderade förkunskaper: Rekommenderas: Introduktion till hållbara samhällen
prerequisites.en: Recommended prerequisites: Suggested: KEY-C1010 Introduction to Sustainable Communities

learningOutcomes.fi: Alueidenkäytön suunnittelujärjestelmän käytön tunteminen maankäytön suunnittelussa. Kyky liittää maankäytön suunnittelu osaksi laajempaa maankäyttöpolitiikan kontekstia. Vuorovaikutteisen maankäytön suunnittelun periaatteisiin ja muotoihin tutustuminen. Kestävän kehityksen edistämisen tavoitteen ymmärtäminen ja keinoihin tutustuminen maankäytön suunnittelussa. Maankäytön suunnittelun tiedon ja epävarmuuden hallinnan periaatteiden ymmärtäminen ja tarvittavien tiedon muotojen ja niiden keskinäissuhteiden hahmottaminen. Maankäytön suunnitteluun liittyvän käytännöllis-eettisen harkinnan ja poliittisen ulottuvuuden ymmärtäminen suunnittelun elimellisinä osatekijöinä. Maankäytön suunnittelun tulevaisuusperspektiivien hahmottaminen.
learningOutcomes.sv: Få kännedom om systemet för planering av områdesanvändningen inom markanvändningsplanering. Förmåga att koppla markanvändningsplanering till ett vidare markanvändningspolitiskt kontext. Bekanta sig med principer och former för växelverkan. Förstå målsättningen hållbar utveckling samt bekanta sig med medel för att främja detta inom markanvändningsplanering. Få insikt i planering som ett sätt att hantera osäkerhet samt en uppfattning om information som behövs inom planering och dess betydelse samt inbördes förhållande. Få förtrogenhet med praktisktetiska bedömningar och den politiska dimensionen inom planering. Få en uppfattning om framtida perspektiv inom planering.
learningOutcomes.en: Grasping the planning system in the context of spatial and land use planning. Ability to link land use planning with the broader context of land use policy. Familiarizing with the principles of and approaches to collaborative planning. Understanding the goal of sustainability and familiarizing with related methods in connection to planning. Understanding the nature of planning as coping with uncertainty and the role of different modes of knowledge. Grasping the centrality of ethico-practical judgment and the political dimension in planning. Perception of future perspectives in planning.

content.fi: Kurssilla perehdytään osaamistavoitteiden mukaisiin sisältöihin erilaisten esimerkkitapausten konkretisoimina, joita tarkastellaan maakunta-, yleis- ja asemakaavoituksen kysymyksenasettelujen kautta.
content.sv: Under kursen blir den studerande förtrogen med lärandemålen genom konkreta fallstudier som granskas ur landskaps-, generalplane- och detaljplaneperspektiv.
content.en: The learning objectives are approached as concretized by specific cases that are studied through the perspectives of regional, master and detailed land-use planning.

learningOutcomes.fi: Can identify the requirements for numerical analysis of large complex, thin-walled structures in terms of: physical understanding of the global structural static and vibratory response, force flow, materials and global and local approaches, i.e. homogenization and localization. Can select the structural modelling techniques for different analyses: static, vibratory, ultimate and fatigue strength.
learningOutcomes.sv: Can identify the requirements for numerical analysis of large complex, thin-walled structures in terms of: physical understanding of the global structural static and vibratory response, force flow, materials and global and local approaches, i.e. homogenization and localization. content.fi: Design, Load modeling, Discretization; Isotropic, Orthotropic Materials & Sandwich Structures; Offset beams; Equivalent plates and shells; Sub-models & Static analysis; Fatigue analysis; Vibration analysis; Buckling analysis; Ultimate and accidental strength analysis; Crashworthiness
content.sv: Design, Load modeling, Discretization; Isotropic, Orthotropic Materials & Sandwich Structures; Offset beams; Equivalent plates and shells; Sub-models & Static analysis; Fatigue analysis; Vibration analysis; Buckling analysis; Ultimate and accidental strength analysis; Crashworthiness
content.en: Design, Load modeling, Discretization; Isotropic, Orthotropic Materials & Sandwich Structures; Offset beams; Equivalent plates and shells; Sub-models & Static analysis; Fatigue analysis; Vibration analysis; Buckling analysis; Ultimate and accidental strength analysis; Crashworthiness

assesmentMethods.fi: The course utilizes problem-based-learning concept so that the students are encouraged to work on selected application case throughout the course. The aim of the course is to identify a thin-walled strucutre that the students will analyze using finite element method for different limit states (serviability, ultimate, fatigue and accidental). Each week we define a subtask to be solved, lectures will be given and we conclude the week on question hour where students can ask questions related to their projects. Each week the student groups (3-5 persons) return a written report showing in the form of living document that build the course report in steps. The weekly submissions will be graded from 1-5.The weekly submissions will contribute 50% of the course grade. The remaining 50% of the grade is defined by the final exam. The grading is based 50% on technical contents, 20% on using techical aids, 15% on reporting and 15% on reflection.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija: - ymmärtää kestävien yhdyskuntien, vesitekniikan, liikennetekniikan ja maankäytön suunnittelun avainkysymyksiä
- osaa jäsentää kestäviin yhdyskuntiin liittyviä teoreettisia ja käytännöllisiä näkökohtia ja osaa soveltaa oppimaansa harjoitustehtävissä
- osaa toimia ryhmässä vuorovaikutteisesti keskustellen ja yhdessä ongelmia ratkoen
- osaa etsiä ja analysoida tietoa ja soveltaa sitä harjoitustehtävissä
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter kursen en student:

- förstår centrala frågorna för hållbara samhällen, vattenteknik, trafikteknik och markanvändningsplanering
- kan strukturera de teoretiska och praktiska aspekterna kring hållbara samhällen och kan använda dessa i kursuppgifter
- kan arbeta i grupp på ett interaktivt sätt, och lösa problem tillsammans
- kan söka och analysera information och tillämpa den i kursuppgifter
learningOutcomes.en:
After the course a student:
- understands key questions of sustainable communities, water engineering, transport engineering and land use planning
- is able to structure the theoretical and practical aspects related to sustainable communities and is able to utilise these in course assignments 
- is able to work in a group in an interactive way, and solve problems together
- is able to search for and analyze information and apply it in course assignments

content.fi: - Johdatus vesitekniikan, liikennetekniikan sekä maankäytön suunnittelun keskeisiin sisältöihin, menetelmiin ja haasteisiin- veden kierron perusteet, vesivarojen ja yhdyskuntien väliset kytkökset- kestävien yhdyskuntien suunnittelun perusteet ja historiallis-yhteiskunnallinen viitekehys
content.sv:
-introduktion till huvudinnehåll, metoder och utmaningar av vattenteknik, trafikteknik och markanvändningsplanering
-grunder i hydrologisk kretslopp, och kopplingarna mellan vattenresurser och samhällen
-grunder och det historiskt-sociala ramverket av planering av hållbara samhällen
content.en: -introduction to key questions, methods and challenges of water engineering, transportation engineering and land use planning - the principles of the hydrological cycle, and the connections between water resources and communities - the basics and the historical-societal framework of planning of sustainable communities

prerequisites.fi: Hyödyllisiä: MS-A0205 Differentiaali- ja integraalilaskenta 2 (ENG), KJR-C1001 Statiikka ja dynamiikka, KJR-C2002 Kontinuumimekaniikan perusteet
prerequisites.sv: Nyttiga: MS-A0205 Differential- och integralkalkyl 2 (ENG), KJR-C1001 Statik och dynamik, KJR-C2002 Grundkurs i kontinuumsmekanik
prerequisites.en: Useful: MS-A0205 Differential and integral calculus 2 (ENG), KJR-C1001 Statics and Dynamics, KJR-C2002 Foundations on Continuum Mechanics

learningOutcomes.fi: Kurssin keskeisenä osaamistavoitteena on opiskelijan virtausmekaanisen yleissivistyksen kehittäminen. Paino on keskeisten käsitteiden, terminologian, keskeisten virtausilmiöiden ja yksinkertaisten perusvirtausongelmien ratkaisutekniikoiden oppimisessa. Kurssin suorittanut opiskelija osaa käyttää virtausmekaniikan termistöä ja osaa selittää, mitä virtausmekaniikan keskeiset käsitteet tarkoittavat, mihin periaatteisiin virtausmekaniikan perusyhtälöt perustuvat ja miten yhtälöitä voidaan yksinkertaistaa. Opiskelija osaa selittää dimensioanalyysin perusajatuksen ja soveltaa sitä virtausmekaniikassa esimerkiksi koetulosten skaalaamiseksi. Opiskelija osaa ratkaista yksinkertaisia virtausteknisiä ongelmia, kuten määrittää putkiston tilavuusvirran, painehäviön tai pumpun nostokorkeuden ja määrittää kappaleisiin vaikuttavia voimia, momentteja tai pyörivien virtauskoneiden ominaisuuksia virtausnopeuksien perusteella.
learningOutcomes.sv: Det centrala lärandemålet på kurssen är att utveckla studentens allmänbildning i strömningsmekanik. Tyngdpunkten ligger på centrala begrepp, terminologi, centrala strömingsfenomen och lösningstekniker för enkla problem i strömningsmekanik. Efter avlagd kurs kan den studerande använda terminologin i strömningsmekanik och kan förklara betydelsen av de centrala begreppen, av vilka princip kan man härleda strömningsekvationerna och hur kan man förenkla ekvationerna. Den studenten kan förklara grundidén i dimensionsanalys och kan tillämpa den i strömningsmekanik bl.a. för att skala resultat från modelprov. Studenten kan lösa enkla problem i strömningsmekanik, liksom beräkna volymströmnen, tryvkförlusten eller lyfthöjd av pump i rörsystem och beräkna krafter och momenter som verkar på kroppar eller egenskaper av strömningsmaskiner på grund av strömningshastigheter.
learningOutcomes.en: The central learning objective of the course is to build up the student's all-round education in fluid mechanics. The weight is on learning of central concepts, terminology, flow phenomena and solution techniques for basic fluid mechanics problems. A student, who has completed the course, is able to use the terminology in fluid mechanics and has an ability to explain the meaning of the central concepts in fluid mechanics, the principles behind the fundamental equations and how these equations can be simplified. The student has an ability to explain the basic idea of dimensional analysis and to apply it in fluid mechanics e.g. for the scaling of model test results. The student is able to solve simple problems in fluid mechanics e.g. to determine the flowrate, pressure loss or pump head in pipe system and to determine forces or moments on bodies or characteristics of rotating flow machinery based on fluid velocity.

literature.en: Young, Munson, Okiishi and Huebsch: Introduction to fluid mechanics, 5th edition (other editions can be used as well)
literature.fi: Young, Munson, Okiishi ja Huebsch: Introduction to fluid mechanics, 5th edition (myös muut painokset käyvät)
literature.sv: Young, Munson, Okiishi och Huebsch: Introduction to fluid mechanics, 5th edition (andra utgåvor passar också)

content.fi: Levossa oleva fluidi ja paine; fluidin liike; Bernoullin yhtälö ja sen käyttö; kontrollitilavuusajattelu ja säilymisperiaate virtausmekaniikassa; energiayhtälö, häviöt ja laajennettu Bernoullin yhtälö; differentiaalimuotoiset yhtälöt; potentiaalivirtaus ja ratkaisujen superponointi; dimensioanalyysi; putkivirtaukset; rajakerros ja virtaus kappaleiden ympäri; vastus ja nostovoima; pyörivät virtauskoneet.
content.sv: Stillastående fluid och tryck; Bernoullis ekvation och dess tillämpning, kontrolvolym och konserveringsprincip i strömningsmekanik; energiekvation, förluster och utvecklade Bernoulli ekvation; ekvationer i differentialform; potentialströmning och superposition av lösningar; dimensionsanalys; strömning i rör; gränsskikt och strömning kring kroppar; motstånd och lyft; roterande strömningsmaskiner.
content.en: Fluid at rest and pressure; Bernoulli equation and its application; control volume approach and conservation principle in fluid mechanics; energy equation, losses and the extended Bernoulli equation; differential equations; potential flow and superposition of solutions; dimensionalanalysis; pipe flow; boundary layer and flow around bodies; lift and drag; rotating flow machinery.

learningOutcomes.fi:
Kurssin suoritettuaan opiskelija:
- Osaa käyttää kolmiulotteista CAD:ia tuotesuunnittelussa.
- Osaa laatia tuotteen teknisen dokumentaation.
learningOutcomes.sv:
Efter avslutad kurs kan studenten:
- Använda tredimensionell CAD för produktutformning.
- Skapa teknisk dokumentation för produkten.
learningOutcomes.en:
After completing the course, the student:
- Can use three-dimensional CAD in product design.
- Can prepare the technical documentation of a product.

content.fi: Konetekniikan kolmiulotteisen tietokoneavusteisen suunnitteluohjelmiston (CAD) esittely, sisältäen osa- ja kokoonpanomallinnuksen sekä teknisen dokumentaation. Käsitellään tilavuus- ja pintamallinnusta, parametristä suunnittelua sekä skeleton-tekniikkaa. Kurssilla käytössä PTC Creo -ohjelmisto.
content.sv: Presentation av tredimensionell datorkonstruktionsprogramvara (CAD) inom maskinteknik, inklusive del- och sammansättningsmodellering samt teknisk dokumentation. Inkluderar volym- och ytmodellering, parametrisk design och skeleton-teknik. PTC Creo-programvaran används under kursen.
content.en: Introduction to three-dimensional computer-aided design software (CAD) in mechanical engineering, including part and assembly modeling and technical documentation. The course covers volume and surface modeling, parametric design, and skeleton technique. The PTC Creo software is used in the course.

learningOutcomes.fi:
A Student 
-  understand the basic concept of Stability and its nature, Equilibrium paths, stable, unstable.
-  understand stability of Frame structures
 - understands the warping torsion and Saint-Venant torsion of thin-walled members.
 - is able to analyze general problems of torsion.
- knows and recognizes the energy-based stability analysis and initial imperfections of the structures.
- understands the basics for modeling the stability problems mathamatically.
- is able to solve in-plane buckling of plane frames and arches.
- recognizes the torsional and lateral buckling of thin-walled members
- is able to handle problems of bucling of plates and cylidrical shells.

content.fi:
Basic concept of stability, its nature, equilibrium paths and critical points. 
Stability criteria and the nature of an equilibrium path.
Stability of Frame structures
Warping torsion of thin-walled members.
Energy-based stability analysis.Effect of initial imperfections.In-plane buckling of plane frames and arches.Torsional and lateral buckling of thin-walled members with open cross-section.
Buckling of plates and cylindrical shells.

prerequisites.fi:
Basic courses of BSc level engineering mathematic, physics, computer science.
Common studies courses CIV-E1060 Engineering Computation and Simulation,
CIV-E1020 Mechanics of Beam and Frame Structures,
CIV-E1050 Heat and Mass Transfer in Buildings as well as CIV-E1030 Fundamentals of Structural Design.
Advanced studies course CIV-E4090 Mechanics of Plate and Shell Structures.
prerequisites.sv:
Basic courses of BSc level engineering mathematic, physics, computer science.
Common studies courses CIV-E1060 Engineering Computation and Simulation,
CIV-E1020 Mechanics of Beam and Frame Structures,
CIV-E1050 Heat and Mass Transfer in Buildings as well as CIV-E1030 Fundamentals of Structural Design.
Advanced studies course CIV-E4090 Mechanics of Plate and Shell Structures.
prerequisites.en:
Basic courses of BSc level engineering mathematic, physics, computer science.
Common studies courses CIV-E1060 Engineering Computation and Simulation,
CIV-E1020 Mechanics of Beam and Frame Structures,
